description: Construction of 13, two-storey dwellings (4x2 bed flats and 9x3 bed houses) parking, cycle parking, access and layout of internal road, and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and in accordance with the policy 4.1 of the Council's Adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A to H (inclusive) of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no additions / extensions of any kind, porches, outbuildings hard surfacing within curtilage etc to the dwellings shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:  To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the amenities of adjoining properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To prevent an overdevelopment of the site and to protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of development on site, details of refuse storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority showing all bin storage located at the rear of the approved building (fronting Queens Walk) and accessible to both residents and refuse collection workers via a suitable footpath.  The refuse bin stores shall be constructed in accordance with the subsequently approved drawings and shall be provided before commencement of the use and thereafter retained for the duration of the use.  Reason: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before the development is commenced a detailed site investigation shall be carried out to establish if the site is contaminated, to assess the degree and nature of the contamination present, and to determine its potential for the pollution of the water environment.  The method and extent of this investigation shall be agreed with the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the work. Details of appropriate measure to remove contaminated material and to prevent pollution of ground water and surface water, including provisions for monitoring, shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences.  The development shall then proceed in strict accordance with the measures approved.  REASON:  To remove contamination from the site and to prevent pollution of the water environment in accordance with policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the Adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, and a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  The landscaping works hereby approved shall be permanently retained for the duration of the development.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority..  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and the privacy of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the Council's Adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of measures to be taken to prevent damage to trees to be retained within the site in accordance BS 5837:2005 or whose root systems or canopies extend into the site during the construction process has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  Reason: To protect trees on site and the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | Details of a demolition and construction method statement, including proposed vehicular access to the site, the provision of compound and storage areas, foundation design and type, and the erection of scaffolding, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  REASON:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall commence on site until all details of site drainage have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: In order to ensure the health, vitality and well being of retained trees on the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the building is occupied and retained thereafter.  Development shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the approved details.   Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before the development is commenced, details of external lighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The lighting shall thereafter be provided and maintained solely in accordance with the approved details.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policy 4.12 of the Council's adopted UDP ' New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application, detailed drawings to show two car parking spaces within the car park servicing the existing units within Sandgate House, set out to disabled space standard, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences and the details so approved shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON:  To provide adequate facilities for disabled residents and visitors, in accordance with policies 4.3, 5.5 and 9.1 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing PL300F A, before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide accessible and secure parking for 4cycles in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists of units 1-4  in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Any garage constructed as part of the development hereby permitted shall only be used for car parking only and not for any separate residential use or for any industrial, commercial or business use.  REASON:  To ensure the site is not overdeveloped and to protect the amenity of the area in accordance with adopted policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | There shall be no obstruction above 0.6m in height at any time within pedestrian visibility splay areas at the back line of the footway / access road that measure 1.5m deep and 1.5m wide either side of each of the vehicular access points to the site, communal car park and parking spaces for the proposed houses. The new access points as approved shall be constructed before any part of the development permitted is first occupied or brought into use and the pedestrian visibility splays shall be permanently retained in the form described in this condition.  REASON: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plan shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Arrangements shall be put in place throughout the duration of the building works to clean the wheels of vehicles leaving the site and to ensure the security of any loads being removed from the site. These measures shall be put into effect on each vehicle leaving the site.  REASON: To prevent the spread of mud, dirt and debris on the adjoining roads, in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | For the duration of construction, no deliveries to the site shall take place before 9.30 am and after 4 pm. on Monday to Friday, before 8 am and after 1 p.m. on Saturdays, and not at all on Sundays or public or bank holidays.   REASON: To ensure highway safety in Queens Walk and to protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The internal access road and pedestrian footpaths as approved by the Local Planning Authority shall be constructed / provided before first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate and satisfactory provision for vehicular and pedestrian access within the site is provided in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a scheme for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) from external noise, including aircraft noise, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 Of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Detailed drawings of the approved development shall be submitted to ensure compliance with the aims and objectives of the 'Secured by Design' scheme, and any such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any unit, and thereafter shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure the safety of future residents, and to ensure that the proposed development achieves  the required crime prevention elements as detailed by the Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime', in accordance with policies 4.1, 8.1 and 8.8 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the occupation of the development, details of the raised planter beds in front of units 11-13 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained, unless agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To protect the character and appearance of the area and to prevent excessive parking at the site that would be above the Council's maximum standards of 1 space per unit, in accordance with Policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the buildings so that at least 10% of all energy requirements within the resulting development are sourced from renewable energy resources, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development permanently retained thereafter.   REASON: To ensure that the development incorporates energy efficiency measures, in accordance with policy 2.9 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, no development shall commence until a plan showing the new internal access road serving units 1 - 13 to be surfaced with block paving materials as a shared surface to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   The approved details shall be implemented before the development hereby approved is occupied and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that pedestrian and vehicular access and safety is not prejudiced, in accordance with policies 5.5 and 9.1 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place on site until a written phasing plan showing the construction and completion of the approved car parking area serving residents of the existing properties in Sandgate House, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The phasing plan shall show the time when the new car parking area shall be open to use by residents, which shall be before the completion of new houses on the development, and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved phasing plan, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate parking is provided for existing residents at the earliest opportunity, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004)
site_number: Land to the rear of Sandgate House
